p: As regards the visual descriptors (clearness, green and yellow reflections) and the basic positive sensory notes of bitterness and pungency no significative changes could be observed in the EVOO samples differently stored for 125 days (t3) from packaging compared to the sample at the time of packaging (data not shown). This is in contrast with the decrease in phenolics ( Table 2), generally linked to the perception of bitterness, astringency and pungency, and which presence is not only important for the organoleptic and nutritional qualities of the oil but also for its conservation over time ( Bertuccioli and Monteleone, 2014).
